metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10870 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
Zim through 0.72.1 creates temporary directories with predictable names. A malicious user could predict and create Zim's temporary directories and prevent other users from being able to start Zim, resulting in a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10870` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

zim - 0.74.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zim package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.74.3-1').
